title: Tech Talk: Web3 & Blockchain
description: The Tech Talk on Web3 & Blockchain held on October 30, 2025, was a groundbreaking workshop that brought together students, developers, and tech enthusiasts to explore the future of decentralized technologies. The session began with an introduction to the evolution of the internet, highlighting the transition from Web1 to Web2 and now to Web3. Speakers from leading blockchain startups and university researchers shared insights into how blockchain is reshaping industries like finance, healthcare, supply chain, and digital identity. Attendees learned about smart contracts, decentralized applications (dApps), and the role of consensus mechanisms in maintaining trustless systems. The workshop featured live demos of Ethereum-based applications, discussions on NFTs and tokenomics, and a hands-on segment where participants created their own wallets and interacted with test networks. The event emphasized the ethical implications of decentralization, including privacy, governance, and accessibility. With 45 attendees actively engaging in breakout sessions and Q&A panels, the Tech Talk served as a launchpad for future blockchain initiatives within the college. Students left with a deeper understanding of how Web3 can empower individuals and communities, and many expressed interest in forming a blockchain club to continue exploring this transformative field. The organizers provided curated resources, including whitepapers, GitHub repositories, and learning paths for beginners. Overall, the event was a resounding success, sparking curiosity and collaboration across departments. It demonstrated the power of interdisciplinary learning and the importance of staying ahead in a rapidly evolving tech landscape. The workshop concluded with a networking session and a call to action for students to build, contribute, and innovate in the Web3 space.

title: Photography Competition
description: The Photography Competition held on November 2, 2025, was a vibrant celebration of visual storytelling and artistic expression. Organized by the Cultural Committee, the event invited students from all departments to submit their best photographs under themes such as Nature, Portraits, Urban Life, and Abstract. With 67 participants, the competition showcased a diverse range of styles, techniques, and perspectives. The college auditorium was transformed into a gallery space, where printed and digital photographs were displayed for public viewing. Judges included professional photographers, faculty members, and alumni with backgrounds in media and design. Each entry was evaluated based on composition, creativity, emotional impact, and technical execution. The event began with an opening ceremony featuring a keynote on the evolution of photography in the digital age, followed by interactive sessions on mobile photography, editing tools, and visual storytelling. Workshops on lighting, framing, and post-processing were held throughout the day, allowing students to refine their skills and learn from experts. The competition culminated in an award ceremony where winners were announced across categories, with special mentions for originality and social impact. The top entries were featured in the college magazine and social media channels, giving students a platform to showcase their talent. Beyond the contest, the event fostered a sense of community among creatives, encouraging collaboration and peer learning. Participants shared their inspirations, techniques, and stories behind each shot, creating a rich dialogue around art and identity. The Photography Competition not only celebrated individual achievement but also highlighted the power of visual media to connect, inspire, and provoke thought. It was a testament to the college’s commitment to nurturing holistic development and providing spaces for artistic exploration.

title: Cricket Tournament Finals
description: The Cricket Tournament Finals held on November 8, 2025, was the most anticipated sports event of the semester, drawing a crowd of over 120 enthusiastic attendees. The final match was the culmination of a month-long inter-departmental tournament that saw fierce competition, strategic gameplay, and incredible sportsmanship. Held at the college ground, the atmosphere was electric with banners, cheers, and live commentary. The two finalist teams — Computer Science and Mechanical Engineering — had battled their way through multiple rounds, showcasing agility, teamwork, and tactical brilliance. The finals began with a ceremonial toss and a brief address by the Sports Coordinator, emphasizing the values of discipline, respect, and perseverance. The match itself was a nail-biter, with stunning boundaries, tight bowling spells, and dramatic run-outs. Spectators were treated to thrilling moments, including a last-over chase that kept everyone on edge. Beyond the game, the event featured food stalls, music, and interactive zones for fans, making it a full-fledged sports carnival. The organizing team ensured smooth logistics, safety protocols, and real-time score updates via a student-built app. Post-match, an award ceremony honored the winning team, best player, emerging talent, and fair play awardees. The event also recognized volunteers, umpires, and support staff for their dedication. The Cricket Finals served as a platform for students to bond, celebrate athleticism, and take pride in their departments. It reinforced the role of sports in building leadership, resilience, and community spirit. Many attendees expressed interest in joining the college sports council, and plans were announced for upcoming tournaments in football and volleyball. The event concluded with a group photo, chants of victory, and a shared sense of accomplishment. It was more than just a match — it was a memory etched in the hearts of everyone present.

title: AI Hackathon 2025
description: The AI Hackathon 2025, organized on November 10, 2025, was a thrilling 24-hour event that challenged students to build innovative AI-powered solutions for real-world problems. Over 80 participants, including coders, designers, and problem-solvers, formed interdisciplinary teams to tackle themes like healthcare diagnostics, sustainable energy, and smart education. Mentors from the tech industry guided participants through ideation and prototyping stages. The atmosphere buzzed with creativity as teams used Python, TensorFlow, and cloud APIs to bring their ideas to life. At the end of the hackathon, each team pitched their projects to a panel of judges. The top projects received recognition for innovation, feasibility, and social impact. The event highlighted how AI can drive positive change and encouraged students to pursue careers in data science and machine learning.

title: Music Fest: Rhythms of GEU
description: Held on November 12, 2025, the Music Fest 'Rhythms of GEU' turned the central lawn into a stage of melodies and beats. The event featured live band performances, solo singing competitions, and DJ sets that kept the crowd energized. With more than 150 attendees, it was one of the most attended cultural nights of the year. Renowned local musicians were invited as guest judges, and students showcased their vocal and instrumental talents across genres from classical to pop. The fest also featured open mic sessions and collaborative jam circles, creating an inclusive atmosphere where everyone could express their musical side. The evening concluded with a mesmerizing fusion performance blending traditional Indian instruments with modern electronic music, earning standing ovations.

title: Coding Battle: CodeStorm
description: CodeStorm, the annual competitive programming contest, was held on November 15, 2025, bringing together 95 coders from various departments. The event tested participants’ problem-solving skills across three intense rounds: logic puzzles, algorithm design, and debugging challenges. Using platforms like HackerRank and CodeChef, contestants battled against time to score the highest points. The event aimed to enhance logical reasoning and coding efficiency while fostering healthy competition. Industry professionals hosted a post-event seminar on best practices in competitive programming and real-world applications of algorithms. The winners were awarded cash prizes, certificates, and internship opportunities from partner tech firms.

title: Yoga & Wellness Workshop
description: The Yoga & Wellness Workshop held on November 18, 2025, promoted mindfulness and holistic well-being among students and faculty. The session began early in the morning with guided yoga led by certified instructors, followed by discussions on stress management, nutrition, and the importance of mental health. Attendees learned breathing techniques, simple desk exercises, and meditation practices suitable for everyday life. The event saw active participation from over 60 students and staff members. The wellness team also distributed pamphlets on healthy routines and organized a mini Q&A session with psychologists. The workshop ended with a serene meditation circle, leaving everyone refreshed and motivated to maintain balance in academic and personal life.

title: Entrepreneurship Summit
description: The Entrepreneurship Summit held on November 22, 2025, served as a vibrant platform for aspiring student entrepreneurs. Organized by the Innovation & Incubation Cell, the summit featured keynote speeches from startup founders, venture capitalists, and successful alumni. With over 110 attendees, the event included workshops on business modeling, fundraising, and pitching techniques. A startup expo allowed students to showcase prototypes and receive feedback from investors. The highlight was the 'Pitch Arena,' where ten shortlisted teams presented their business ideas, competing for seed funding and incubation support. The summit concluded with networking sessions and mentorship sign-ups, igniting a spirit of innovation across campus.

title: Annual Alumni Meet
description: The Annual Alumni Meet, held on November 30, 2025, brought together past and present students for a day filled with nostalgia, connection, and inspiration. The event began with a warm welcome ceremony followed by keynote speeches from distinguished alumni who shared their journeys beyond college. Cultural performances, award recognitions, and a campus tour added a personal touch to the evening. A networking dinner allowed alumni and current students to exchange experiences and career insights. With over 200 attendees, the event celebrated the legacy of the institution and strengthened the alumni network. The event concluded with a group photo, heartfelt goodbyes, and renewed commitments to contribute to the college community.

title: Cultural Fest - Euphoria
description: Euphoria, the annual Cultural Fest held on December 5, 2025, was a grand celebration of talent, creativity, and diversity. The campus came alive with music, dance, drama, and fashion shows that captivated audiences throughout the day. With over 300 participants and 500 spectators, the fest featured inter-departmental competitions, art exhibitions, and food stalls offering cuisines from around the country. Highlights included a fashion parade, group dance battles, and a star performance by a popular guest artist. Euphoria served as a vibrant platform for students to express themselves beyond academics, fostering unity, confidence, and cultural appreciation across the college community.

title: Tech Giants Career Fair
description: The Tech Giants Career Fair, held on December 10, 2025, connected students with top recruiters from leading technology companies including Infosys, TCS, Microsoft, and Deloitte. Over 25 companies set up interactive booths, offering insights into career opportunities, internships, and emerging tech roles. The event featured resume-building workshops, mock interviews, and networking sessions with HR professionals and alumni working in the tech industry. With more than 400 attendees, the fair empowered students to explore diverse career paths and gain exposure to real-world hiring processes. The initiative strengthened industry-academia collaboration and motivated students to prepare for the next phase of their professional journey.
